headline: Tactical E-Commerce Gets Lifeline with Specialized Payment Processing
summary: As major payment gateways continue restrictions on regulated products, tactical e-commerce businesses across the United States are finding it increasingly difficult to accept credit cards online. In response, Blue Payment Agency announced an expanded focus on tactical–friendly payment processing, designed to help website owners accept credit cards reliably after being declined or shut down by Square, Stripe, or PayPal.

headline: Bretton AI raises $75 million to use AI to combat financial crime
summary: With new funding from Sapphire Ventures and Greylock Partners, the startup is upending anti-money laundering prevention at top financial firms.

headline: PayPal: Cheap For A Reason As The Moat Disappears
summary: PayPal (PYPL) faces a deteriorating moat as competitors like Apple Pay and Google Pay erode its online payments dominance.

headline: Truist Securities Maintains Sell on PayPal Holdings, Lowers Price Target to $39
summary: Truist Securities  analyst Matthew Coad   maintains PayPal Holdings (NASDAQ:PYPL) with a Sell and lowers the price target from $58 to $39.

headline: PayPal’s Q4 Earnings Call: Our Top 5 Analyst Questions
summary: PayPal’s fourth quarter was marked by underperformance relative to Wall Street’s revenue and earnings expectations, with management citing execution issues in its core branded checkout business as a primary challenge. Outgoing CEO Alex Chriss and interim CEO Jamie Miller acknowledged that operational delays and slower-than-expected merchant adoption hampered results. headline: Analyst Upgrade And Insider Signals Reframe SoFi’s Long Term Valuation
summary: Citizens upgraded SoFi Technologies (NasdaqGS:SOFI) to Outperform, describing the recent share price decline as technical and highlighting the company as a long term fintech compounder. J.P. Morgan analysts identified SoFi as their preferred fintech stock over PayPal, pointing to the company’s revenue and membership growth. Insider activity included buying by company insiders alongside news of a planned share sale by the vice chairman, drawing fresh attention to the stock. SoFi...
